page.title: 04HARESBY LONNEN,HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: The land was originally used as{Common {land}for the villagers of Haydon Bridge. In the late nineteenth century the land was enclosed & fenced & a track built allowing access to the fields. Today,to the south side of the track the land is farmed by Mr.J. Wardle & on the north by Mr.Pigg up to Pit Covert. The fields on the south side are well- drained & fertile & are used for{beef & sheep grazing}& for silage & hay. In one of the grazing fields an area of{spruce}has been planted, giving shelter to grazing animals. On the north side of the track the land is very rough & wet; it is only suitable for a few sheep & some hardy beef cattle. There is also a sheep dip on the north side of the track used twice a year to protect sheep from lice and ticks.
